snippet: The Yankees have been shopping for bargains because they want to keep their 2014 payroll below $189 million to take advantage of incentives built into the collective bargaining agreement.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column observes that York Yankees have been shopping for bargains in an off-season marked by ample cash and big-salary deals; holds that team wants to keep their 2014 payroll below $189 million in order to take advantage of incentives built into the league's new collective bargaining agreement.
lead_paragraph: The Yankees have been shopping for bargains because they want to keep their 2014 payroll below $189 million to take advantage of incentives built into the collective bargaining agreement.

headline.seo: Views on Free Agency Conflict Despite a River of Cash
headline.main: Conflicting Views on How to Navigate a River of Cash
headline.print_headline: Conflicting Views on How to Navigate a River of Cash
